definition: to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh
catty/(PRC) weight equal to 500 g/(Tw) weight equal to 600 g/(HK, Malaysia, Singapore) slightly over 604 g
"dot" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 3)/see also 點|点[dian3]
to reject/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to repel
to be full of/to flood/to congest
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
mutual repulsion (e.g. electrostatic)/to repel one another

sentences.english: Those three modern novels are denounced as equally obscene by the wowser .
sentences.chinese: 那三本現代小說均被道學先生們斥爲同樣猥褻。

sentences.english: We could hear the director rebuking Jim for being late from work again.
sentences.chinese: 我們聽得見主任在斥辭責吉姆上班又遲到了。

sentences.english: The liberal candidate was accused by his conservation opponent of being a bleeding heart on welfare issues.
sentences.chinese: 自由派候選人在福利問題上被保守派對手斥爲老好人。

sentences.english: Democrats dismissed the moves as political gimmickry.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨人將此舉斥爲政治伎倆。

sentences.english: The government has poured tremendous resources into fostering the preservation of local minority cultures.
sentences.chinese: 政府已經斥重資來加強當地少數民族的文化保存。

sentences.english: The repulsion point is composition of pressure point and joining place.
sentences.chinese: 斥力點，和壓力點交匯處叫合力。

sentences.english: Trillion home see to filial piety do dessert, denounced him unwillingly.
sentences.chinese: 兆榮回家看見至孝在做甜品，斥他不爭氣。

sentences.english: Spitting was mostly associated with smoking, both denounced by women as bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 吐痰大多與吸菸有關，二者都被婦女斥爲陋習。

sentences.english: Democrats dismissed the moves as political gimmickry, and Sen.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨人將此舉斥爲政治伎倆。

sentences.english: Some people are inclined to dismiss such questions as alarmist.
sentences.chinese: 有些人傾向於將這樣的問題斥爲聳人聽聞。

definition: to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
